external.name: --path
external.params: string: path to directory to watch
external.description: Specifies the directory to watch for file changes. Defaults to current working directory if not provided.

external.name: --config
external.params: string: path to YAML config file (default: config.yaml)
external.description: Specifies the configuration file location. Config includes agent settings, watch settings, and log level.

external.name: --version
external.description: Prints the version string and exits. Version is injected at build time via ldflags.

external.name: --once
external.description: Runs in one-shot mode: performs initial scan, triggers analysis, then exits without entering watch mode. Useful for CI/CD pipelines, pre-commit hooks, or generating documentation without a background process.

external.name: --log-level
external.params: string: error, notice, info, or debug
external.description: Overrides the log level from config file. Takes precedence over config.yaml log_level setting.

external.name: config.yaml
external.params: YAML file with: log_level, agent.api_key, agent.model, watch.ignore_patterns, watch.debounce_ms, watch.max_wait_ms
external.description: Main configuration file. Agent settings are optional (uses kimi defaults). Watch settings control file monitoring behavior.

external.name: .memo/index/*.json
external.params: JSON files: arch.json, interface.json, stories.json, issues.json
external.description: Output directory containing documentation files maintained by the AI agent. Created automatically on first run with empty structures.

external.name: .gitignore
external.description: If present in watched directory, patterns are merged into ignore_patterns to avoid watching ignored files.

internal.name: Watcher.onChange(files []string)
internal.params: files: list of absolute paths to changed files
internal.description: Callback function passed to NewWatcher. Called with batched file changes after debounce period expires or max-wait time is reached.

internal.name: Watcher.Flush()
internal.description: Immediately processes all pending file changes, stopping both debounce and max-wait timers. Called by internal timers, but now public to support once-mode where main.go can trigger flush directly after ScanAll().

internal.name: Analyser.Analyse(ctx, changedFiles []string)
internal.params: ctx: context for cancellation, changedFiles: list of changed file paths
internal.description: Main analysis entry point. Sends prompts to AI agent, validates output, retries with feedback on validation failures (up to 5 attempts).

internal.name: Analyser.runPrompt(ctx, session, prompt string) error
internal.params: ctx: context, session: agent session, prompt: text to send
internal.description: Sends a prompt to the agent session and processes the streamed response. Uses LineBuffer for buffering output, handles ApprovalRequest (auto-approve), ContentPart (text output), and StatusUpdate (step completion) messages.

internal.name: ValidateIndex(indexDir string) ValidationResult
internal.description: Validates all four JSON files against their schemas. Returns Valid=true if all pass, or list of error strings.

internal.name: Config.MergeGitignore(workDir string) error
internal.description: Loads and parses .gitignore, merges unique patterns into Config.Watch.IgnorePatterns. Skips if no .gitignore exists.

internal.name: NewLineBuffer(timeout time.Duration) *LineBuffer
internal.params: timeout: duration to wait before force-flushing incomplete lines
internal.description: Creates a LineBuffer that accumulates streamed text and flushes on newlines or timeout. Used by runPrompt to produce clean debug output.

internal.name: LineBuffer.Flush(force bool) string
internal.params: force: if true, flush all content; if false, only flush complete lines or on timeout
internal.description: Returns buffered content ready for output. When force=false, buffers incomplete lines until newline arrives or timeout expires.
